channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024020174
item.description:
Report E-2024020174

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: FRANKLIN
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1 cup of a UN1760 corrosive liquid, trade name Low temp dishmachine detergent, which released from a 55 gallon plastic drum due to improper loading as the drum began leaking while the driver was on the road. No Drains, Soils, or waterways were impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024020158
item.description:
Report E-2024020158

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: GREEN BAY
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: WHILE INSURED DRIVER WAS OFFLOADING THE CONSIGNEE'S TANK BEGAN TO OVERFLOW DO TO THE HIGH-LEVEL SENSOR. THE DRIVER CEASED OFFLOADING OPERATI0NS AND WAS UNABLE TO COMPLETE OFFLOADING OF THE MATERIAL. SPILLED WAS CLEANED UP BY CONSIGNEE FACILITY PERSONNEL.

item.title: Report X-2024020083
item.description:
Report X-2024020083

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-27
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO BAY 126 FOR A LEAKING HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE. PROPER PPE WAS DONNED AND LEAKING PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THERE WAS NO SPILL TO CLEAN UP. PACKAGE WAS TRANSPORTED TO DMP. PACKAGE PROCESSED THROUGH THE DMP.
